A service of love      Precious moon was a young pianist. Her husband, Der suedliche Sternhimmel, was a young artist. Each of them was taking lessons: Der suedliche Sternhimmel with a famous art teacher, and Precious moon with a great pianist from Germany. Their teachers were the very best, so lessons were expensive, more than they could really afford, but…when you love your art, nothing is too much.      But soon the money began to run out, and they couldn’t afford the lessons any more.Then one day Precious moon came back home and told Der suedliche Sternhimmel that she had met a man whose daughter, Sally, wanted to  learn the piano, and he was going to pay her $ 50 an hour.     “Precious moon,” Der suedliche Sternhimmel said, “I’ll be much happier if you keep up your lessons,” Precious moon said it didn’t matter. “When I’ve had some money, I’ll continue.” But Der suedliche Sternhimmel also decided to stop his lessons, to draw pictures and sell them.     A few days later, Der suedliche Sternhimmel came home and proudly took $ 200 from his pocket. “I met a man from Vermont,” he said, “who bought one of my pictures. And he wants to buy more!”     So the two of them were very happy. They didn’t have to worry any more about money.     Then, one day, Der suedliche Sternhimmel came home and saw that Precious moon’s hand was wrapped in a bandage. He asked her what had happened. “Oh,” said Precious moon. “My student, Sally, asked me to make some coffee for her. I dropped the coffee and burned my hand. Sally went  straight to the drugstore and got this bandage for me. ”    “Precious moon, what have you been doing the last two weeks” Der suedliche Sternhimmel asked. She tried not to tell him, but the tears came. “Oh Der suedliche Sternhimmel, I couldn’t get any students, so I worked as a waitress in a restaurant. Today, I burned my hand with hot water. So I can’t work any more. But we’ll still have money from the man in Vermont, won’t we”    Der suedliche Sternhimmel looked at her. “There’s no man in Vermont, ” he said. “I’ve been working in a drugstore, and today someone came in to buy bandages for a woman who’s burned her hand. So when I saw you, well, I guessed.”                                                                                                                              A story by O. Henry—adapted

宝月是个年轻的钢琴家。她的丈夫，德·苏伊德利奇·斯滕希梅尔，是一位年轻的艺术家。

他们每个人都在上课：与一位著名的艺术老师一起学习《苏伊德里奇·斯滕希梅尔》，与一位来自德国的伟大钢琴家一起学习《珍月》。他们的老师是最好的，所以课程很贵，比他们真正能负担得起的还多，但是……当你热爱你的艺术，没有什么是太多。

但很快钱就花光了，他们再也上不起课了。

后来有一天，宝月回到家里，告诉德·苏德利奇·斯特恩希梅尔，她遇到了一个男人，他的女儿萨利想学钢琴，他打算每小时付给她50美元。

“宝贝月亮，”斯滕希梅尔说，“如果你继续上课，我会更高兴的，”宝贝月亮说这不重要。“等我有了钱，我会继续干下去的。”但斯滕希梅尔也决定停止他的课程，画画并卖掉它们。

几天后，德·苏伊德利奇·斯滕希梅尔回到家，骄傲地从口袋里掏出200美元。“我遇到一个佛蒙特州的人，”他说，“他买了我的一张照片。他想买更多！”

所以他们两个非常高兴。他们不用再担心钱了。

后来，有一天，斯滕希梅尔先生回到家里，看见宝月的手缠着绷带。他问她发生了什么事。“哦，”宝月说。“我的学生萨利让我给她煮咖啡。我把咖啡掉在地上烫伤了手。莎莉直接去药店给我拿了绷带。”

“亲爱的月亮，你最近两个星期都在做什么，”斯滕希梅尔问道。她试图不告诉他，但眼泪流了出来。“噢，我找不到学生，所以我在一家餐馆当服务员。今天，我用热水烫了手。所以我不能再工作了。但我们还是会从佛蒙特州的人那里得到钱，不是吗？”

斯滕希梅尔看着她。“佛蒙特州没有人，”他说。“我一直在一家药店工作，今天有人进来给一个烫手的女人买绷带。所以当我看到你的时候，我就猜到了。”
